dialog: We're going to play the Schmidt Variation (Mieses Variation)
Black has to take with the b pawn otherwise Qxd8+... White can improve f1 bishop.
The bishop on e3 guards the e pawn... Black typically wants to get rid of the doubled c pawns. Hence, they ofter play d5.
White usually goes for Nc3 and h3 followed by castle... Black wants to pressure the semi-open files. Be aware of pawn structure.
We're going to play the Schmidt Variation (Mieses Variation)
Black typically pins the c3 knight with Bb4... Black rarely wants to lose a dark square bishop for a knight.
